# Code of Conduct

## Our Commitment

We are committed to making participation in the LumenFlow project a respectful,
harassment-free experience for everyone.

We welcome contributors of all backgrounds and experience levels.

## Expected Behavior

- Be respectful and constructive in discussions and reviews.
- Assume good intent and focus on ideas, not people.
- Give actionable feedback and receive feedback professionally.
- Respect boundaries, privacy, and consent.

## Unacceptable Behavior

- Harassment, discrimination, intimidation, or personal attacks.
- Sexualized language or imagery in public project spaces.
- Trolling, insults, derogatory comments, or persistent disruption.
- Publishing private information without explicit permission.

## Scope

This Code of Conduct applies in all project spaces, including:

- GitHub issues and pull requests
- Discussions and review threads
- Community and maintainer communications related to the project

## Reporting

If you experience or witness unacceptable behavior, report it to the maintainers at
`tom@hellm.ai`.

Please include as much context as possible (links, screenshots, timeline). Reports
will be reviewed promptly and handled as confidentially as possible.

## Enforcement

Maintainers may take any action they deem appropriate, including warning,
temporary restrictions, or permanent removal from project spaces.

## Attribution

This document is inspired by the Contributor Covenant and adapted for this
project.
